pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:0.5.eng: 31. The training rule on almsmeals at public guesthouses

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyā avidūre aññatarassa pūgassa āvasathapiṇḍo paññatto hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.2.eng: a certain association was preparing an almsmeal at a public guesthouse not far from Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.3.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṃ piṇḍāya pavisitvā piṇḍaṃ alabhamānā āvasathaṃ agamaṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.3.eng: Then, after robing up in the morning, the monks from the group of six took their bowls and robes and entered Sāvatthī for alms. Not getting anything, they went to that public guesthouse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.4.eng: Because it was a long time since they had been there, people served them respectfully.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.5.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū dutiyampi divasaṃ …pe… tatiyampi divasaṃ pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṃ piṇḍāya pavisitvā piṇḍaṃ alabhamānā āvasathaṃ gantvā bhuñjiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.5.eng: A second and a third day those monks did the same thing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.7.eng: “What’s the point of returning to the monastery?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.8.eng: Tomorrow we’ll just have to come back here.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.9.eng: So they stayed on and on right there, eating alms at the guesthouse,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.10.eng: while the monastics of other religions left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.12.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā anuvasitvā anuvasitvā āvasathapiṇḍaṃ bhuñjissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.12.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics stay on and on, eating alms at the guesthouse?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.13.eng: We don’t prepare the almsfood just for them;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.15.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.15.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.16.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.16.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.17.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū anuvasitvā anuvasitvā āvasathapiṇḍaṃ bhuñjissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.17.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six stay on and on, eating alms at a public guesthouse?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.18.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, anuvasitvā anuvasitvā āvasathapiṇḍaṃ bhuñjathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.18.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.21.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, anuvasitvā anuvasitvā āvasathapiṇḍaṃ bhuñjissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.21.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.23.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.23.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.24.1.pli: “Eko āvasathapiṇḍo bhuñjitabbo. Tato ce uttari bhuñjeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.24.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats more than one almsmeal at a public guesthouse, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.25.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:1.25.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sāriputto kosalesu janapade sāvatthiṃ gacchanto yena aññataro āvasatho tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards Venerable Sāriputta was traveling through the Kosalan country on his way to Sāvatthī when he came to a public guesthouse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.2.eng: Because it was a long time since he had been there, people served him respectfully.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.3.pli: Atha kho āyasmato sāriputtassa bhuttāvissa kharo ābādho uppajji, nāsakkhi tamhā āvasathā pakkamituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.3.eng: After he had eaten, Sāriputta became severely ill, and he was unable to leave that guesthouse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.4.pli: Atha kho te manussā dutiyampi divasaṃ āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.4.eng: On the second day, too, those people said to him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.7.pli: “bhagavatā paṭikkhittaṃ anuvasitvā anuvasitvā āvasathapiṇḍaṃ bhuñjitun”ti kukkuccāyanto na paṭiggahesi;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.7.eng: the Buddha had prohibited eating alms at a public guesthouse after staying on and on, and because he was afraid of wrongdoing, he did not accept.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.8.eng: As a consequence, he missed his meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.9.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.9.eng: When he arrived at Sāvatthī, he told the monks what had happened,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.10.eng: and they in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.11.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.11.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.12.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānena bhikkhunā anuvasitvā anuvasitvā āvasathapiṇḍaṃ bhuñjituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.12.eng: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to stay on at a public guesthouse and eat alms there.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.13.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.13.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.14.1.pli: “Agilānena bhikkhunā eko āvasathapiṇḍo bhuñjitabbo. Tato ce uttari bhuñjeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:2.14.1.eng: ‘If a monk who is not sick eats more than one almsmeal at a public guesthouse, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.1.2.eng: he is able to leave that public guesthouse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.1.4.eng: he is unable to leave that public guesthouse.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.1.6.pli: pañcannaṃ bhojanānaṃ aññataraṃ bhojanaṃ— sālāya vā maṇḍape vā rukkhamūle vā ajjhokāse vā anodissa yāvadattho paññatto hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.1.6.eng: as much as one needs of any of the five cooked foods, prepared for the general public, in a building, under a roof cover, at the foot of a tree, or out in the open.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.1.6.comm: For the rendering of sālā as “building”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.1.7.pli: Agilānena bhikkhunā sakiṃ bhuñjitabbo. Tato ce uttari “bhuñjissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.1.7.eng: A monk who is not sick may eat there once. If he receives food beyond that with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.1.8.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.2.1.pli: Agilāno agilānasaññī tatuttari āvasathapiṇḍaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.2.1.eng: If he is not sick, and he perceives himself as not sick, and he eats more than one almsmeal at a public guesthouse, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.2.2.pli: Agilāno vematiko tatuttari āvasathapiṇḍaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.2.2.eng: If he is not sick, but he is unsure of it, and he eats more than one almsmeal at a public guesthouse, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.2.3.pli: Agilāno gilānasaññī tatuttari āvasathapiṇḍaṃ bhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.2.3.eng: If he is not sick, but he perceives himself as sick, and he eats more than one almsmeal at a public guesthouse, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.2.4.eng: If he is sick, but he perceives himself as not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.2.5.eng: If he is sick, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.2.6.eng: If he is sick, and he perceives himself as sick, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.3.3.eng: if he is not sick and he eats once;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.3.4.eng: if he eats while coming or going;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.3.4.comm: Sp 2.208: Gacchanto vāti yo gacchanto antarāmagge ekadivasaṁ gataṭṭhāne ca ekadivasaṁ bhuñjati, tassāpi anāpatti. Āgacchantepi eseva nayo. Gantvā paccāgacchantopi antarāmagge ekadivasaṁ āgataṭṭhāne ca ekadivasaṁ bhuñjituṁ labhati, “Or going means: whoever is going, if he eats one day on the road and one day at the place he has gone to, there is no offense. The same method applies for one who is coming. After going, even when returning, he may eat one day on the road and one day at the place returned to.” The point seems to be that one may return to the same guesthouse even after one day of traveling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.3.5.eng: if he eats after being invited by the owners;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.3.6.eng: if the food is prepared specifically for him;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.3.7.eng: if there is not as much as he needs;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.3.8.eng: if it is anything apart from the five cooked foods;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.3.10.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc31:3.3.11.eng: The training rule on almsmeals at public guesthouses, the first, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:0.5.eng: 32. The training rule on eating in a group

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena devadatto parihīnalābhasakkāro sapariso kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.2.eng: At that time, because of his loss of material support and honor, Devadatta and his followers had to ask families repeatedly to get invited to meals.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjissanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.4.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics repeatedly ask families to get invited to meals?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.5.pli: Kassa sampannaṃ na manāpaṃ, kassa sāduṃ na ruccatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.5.eng: Who doesn’t like nice food? Who doesn’t prefer tasty food?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.6.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.6.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.7.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.7.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma devadatto sapariso kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.8.eng: “How can Devadatta and his followers repeatedly ask families to get invited to meals?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, devadatta, sapariso kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.9.eng: “Is it true, Devadatta, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, sapariso kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñjissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.12.eng: “Foolish man, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.14.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats in a group, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.16.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.16.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā gilāne bhikkhū bhattena nimantenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards people invited sick monks to a meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.2.eng: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.4.eng: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.5.eng: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to eat in a group.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.6.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.6.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.7.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.8.eng: This is the appropriate occasion: he is sick.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.9.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.9.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā cīvaradānasamaye sacīvarabhattaṃ paṭiyādetvā bhikkhū nimantenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.1.eng: Soon afterwards, during the robe-giving season, people prepared a meal together with robe-cloth and then invited the monks, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.2.eng: “We wish to offer a meal and then give robe-cloth.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.3.eng: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.4.eng: As a result, they only got a small amount of robe-cloth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.6.eng: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group during the robe-giving season.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.7.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.7.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.8.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.9.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.9.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.10.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.10.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussā cīvarakārake bhikkhū bhattena nimantenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.1.eng: Soon afterwards people invited the robe-making monks for a meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.2.eng: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.4.eng: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group at a time when you are making robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.5.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.5.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.6.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.7.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.7.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.8.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.8.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū manussehi saddhiṃ addhānaṃ gacchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.1.eng: Soon afterwards some monks went traveling with a group of people.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.2.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū te manusse etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.2.eng: The monks said to those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.3.eng: “Please wait a moment while we walk for alms.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.6.pli: Bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā na paṭiggaṇhanti—“paṭikkhittaṃ bhagavatā gaṇabhojanan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.6.eng: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.8.eng: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group when you’re traveling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.9.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.9.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.10.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.11.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.11.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.12.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.12.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū manussehi saddhiṃ nāvāya gacchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.1.eng: Soon afterwards some monks were traveling by boat with a group of people.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.2.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū te manusse etadavocuṃ—“muhuttaṃ, āvuso, tīraṃ upanetha; piṇḍāya carissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.2.eng: The monks said to those people, “Please go to the shore for a moment while we walk for alms.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.3.eng: They replied, “Venerables, please eat right here.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.4.pli: Bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā na paṭiggaṇhanti—“paṭikkhittaṃ bhagavatā gaṇabhojanan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.4.eng: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.6.eng: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group when on board a boat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.7.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.7.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.8.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.9.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, nāvābhiruhanasamayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.9.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling; he is on a boat.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.10.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.10.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena disāsu vassaṃvuṭṭhā bhikkhū rājagahaṃ āgacchanti bhagavantaṃ dassanāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.1.eng: Soon afterwards monks who had completed the rainy-season residence in various regions were coming to Rājagaha to visit the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.2.pli: Manussā nānāverajjake bhikkhū passitvā bhattena nimantenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.2.eng: People saw those monks who had come from various countries and invited them for a meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.3.eng: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.5.eng: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group on big occasions.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.6.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.6.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.7.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.8.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, nāvābhiruhanasamayo, mahāsamayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.8.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling; he is on a boat; it is a big occasion.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.9.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.9.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rañño māgadhassa seniyassa bimbisārassa ñātisālohito ājīvakesu pabbajito hoti. Atha kho so ājīvako yena rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā rājānaṃ māgadhaṃ seniyaṃ bimbisāraṃ etadavoca—“icchāmahaṃ, mahārāja, sabbapāsaṇḍikabhattaṃ kātun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.1.eng: Soon afterwards a relative of King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha who had gone forth with the Ājīvaka ascetics went to the king and said, “Great king, I wish to make a meal for the monastics of all religions.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.2.pli: “Sace tvaṃ, bhante, buddhappamukhaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ paṭhamaṃ bhojeyyāsi”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.2.eng: “That’s fine, sir, if you first feed the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.4.pli: Atha kho so ājīvako bhikkhūnaṃ santike dūtaṃ pāhesi—“adhivāsentu me bhikkhū svātanāya bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.4.eng: And he sent a message to the monks: “Please accept a meal from me tomorrow.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.5.eng: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.6.pli: Atha kho so ājīvako yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi, sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho so ājīvako bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.6.eng: That Ājīvaka ascetic then went to the Buddha, exchanged pleasantries with him, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.7.eng: “Good Gotama has gone forth and so have I.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.8.eng: One who has gone forth should receive alms from another who has gone forth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.9.pli: Adhivāsetu me bhavaṃ gotamo svātanāya bhattaṃ saddhiṃ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.9.eng: Good Gotama, please accept a meal from me tomorrow together with the Sangha of monks.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.10.eng: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.11.pli: Atha kho so ājīvako bhagavato adhivāsanaṃ viditvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.11.eng: The Ājīvaka understood that the Buddha had consented, and he left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.12.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.12.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.13.eng: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group when the meal is given by a monastic.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.14.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.14.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.16.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, nāvābhiruhanasamayo, mahāsamayo, samaṇabhattasamayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.16.eng: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling; he is on a boat; it is a big occasion; it is a meal given by a monastic.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.2.pli: yattha cattāro bhikkhū pañcannaṃ bhojanānaṃ aññatarena bhojanena nimantitā bhuñjanti. Etaṃ gaṇabhojanaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.2.eng: wherever four monks, after being invited, eat any of the five cooked foods—this is called “eats in a group”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.4.eng: unless it is an appropriate occasion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.6.eng: even if he has cracked feet, he may eat in a group.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.8.pli: anatthate kathine vassānassa pacchimo māso, atthate kathine pañcamāsā. “Cīvaradānasamayo”ti bhuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.8.eng: if he has not participated in the robe-making ceremony, he may eat in a group during the last month of the rainy season. If he has participated in the robe-making ceremony, he may eat in a group during the five month period.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.8.comm: “Robe-making ceremony” refers to the kathina saṅghakamma, the making of the kathina robe, and the rejoicing in the process, all three together represented by the words (an)atthate kathine . “The five month period” is the last month of the rainy season plus the four months of the cold season. See also kathina in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.9.eng: It is a time of making robes:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.10.eng: when he is making robes, he may eat in a group.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.10.comm: Sp 2.218 says: Yo tattha cīvare kattabbaṁ yaṅkiñci kammaṁ karoti, mahāpaccariyañhi “antamaso sūcivedhanako”tipi vuttaṁ, tena cīvarakārasamayoti bhuñjitabbaṁ, “Whoever does any work to be done in regard to the robe—the Mahāpaccariya says, ‘Even one who just threads the needle’—may eat in a group because he is making a robe.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.12.pli: “addhayojanaṃ gacchissāmī”ti bhuñjitabbaṃ, gacchantena bhuñjitabbaṃ, gatena bhuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.12.eng: he may eat in a group if he intends to travel at least six kilometers, while traveling, and after traveling.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.12.comm: For a discussion of the yojana, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.14.pli: “nāvaṃ abhiruhissāmī”ti bhuñjitabbaṃ, āruḷhena bhuñjitabbaṃ, oruḷhena bhuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.14.eng: he may eat in a group if he intends to board a boat, while on board, and after disembarking.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.16.pli: yattha dve tayo bhikkhū piṇḍāya caritvā yāpenti, catutthe āgate na yāpenti. “Mahāsamayo”ti bhuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.16.eng: if two or three monks can get by on walking for alms, but not a group of four, he may eat in a group.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.17.eng: It is a meal given by a monastic:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.18.pli: yo koci paribbājakasamāpanno bhattaṃ karoti. “Samaṇabhattasamayo”ti bhuñjitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.18.eng: if any kind of wanderer is making the meal, he may eat in a group.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.19.eng: If he receives something intending to eat it, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.20.eng: For every mouthful swallowed, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.1.pli: Gaṇabhojane gaṇabhojanasaññī, aññatra samayā, bhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.1.eng: If he eats in a group, and he perceives it as such, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.2.pli: Gaṇabhojane vematiko, aññatra samayā, bhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.2.eng: If he eats in a group, but he is unsure of it, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.3.pli: Gaṇabhojane nagaṇabhojanasaññī, aññatra samayā, bhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.3.eng: If he eats in a group, but he does not perceive it as such, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.4.eng: If he does not eat in a group, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.5.eng: If he does not eat in a group, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.6.eng: If he does not eat in a group, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.2.eng: if it is an appropriate occasion;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.3.eng: if two or three eat together;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.4.eng: if they eat together after walking for alms;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.5.eng: if it is a regular meal invitation;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.6.eng: if it is a meal for which lots are drawn;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.7.eng: if it is a half-monthly meal;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.7.comm: Sp-ṭ 1.30: Ekasmiṁ pakkhe ekadivasaṁ dātabbaṁ bhattaṁ pakkhikaṁ, “Pakkhikaṁ means: meal to be given one day in one half-month.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.8.eng: if it is on the observance day;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.9.eng: if it is on the day after the observance day;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.10.eng: if it is anything apart from the five cooked foods;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.12.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.13.eng: The training rule on eating in a group, the second, is finished.
